meanings.definition: A member of the Praetorian Guard, an elite unit of the Roman army.
meanings.sent1: The praetorians protected the emperor with great loyalty.
meanings.sent2: The praetorians were highly trained soldiers in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The praetorians joked that they were the emperor's shadow.
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield, the praetorians stood like unbreakable walls.
meanings.sent5: The shining armor of the praetorians dazzled their enemies.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Praetorian Guard.
meanings.sent1: The general wore praetorian armor for the parade.
meanings.sent2: The praetorian helmets were adorned with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The praetorian banner fluttered proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was described as praetorian by the historians.
meanings.sent5: The praetorian discipline was evident in their precise formations.

meanings.definition: A group of influential or powerful individuals who support a particular leader or cause.
meanings.sent1: The business magnate surrounded himself with loyal praetorians.
meanings.sent2: The political candidate had a circle of praetorians advising him.
meanings.sent3: The praetorians of the art world gathered to discuss the new exhibit.
meanings.sent4: She relied on her close-knit group of praetorians for guidance.
meanings.sent5: The praetorians of the music industry were instrumental in his success.
